description: Demolition of existing building and construction of a three storey residential building comprising of 4 x four bedroom houses with associated parking and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 043 PL 001 Rev A, 043 PL 004 Rev A, 043 PL 005 Rev A, 043 PL 006 Rev A, 043 PL 007 Rev A, 043 PL 008 Rev A, 043 PL 009 Rev A, 043 PL 010 Rev A, 043 PL 011 Rev A, 043 PL 012 Rev A, 043 PL 013 (received 27/02/2013) Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used in the development hereby permitted shall be as specified on the approved plan: 043 PL 013 (received 27/02/2013); no other materials shall be used unless prior agreement in writing has been obtained from the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounding area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008, no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and the appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan 043 PL 004 Rev A (received 27/02/2013) shall be laid out prior to first occupation of any of the houses hereby permitted and permanently retained without obstruction.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2011). | The refuse and recycling store shown on the approved drawing ref: 043 PL 004 Rev A (received 27/02/2013) shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwelling and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the living and working conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interest of the environment, in accordance with policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy. | Details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including front boundary treatment, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development. Any trees or other plants that die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of the contamination, and remedial works implemented before building works commence.  Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy 2.7, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of a demolition and construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  Reason:  To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2011). | Prior to the commencement of any site works, a bound photographic record of the existing locally listed building including internal and external features annotated on the existing plans, should be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To ensure that a historical document of the building is archived for future records, in accordance with Council's adopted UDP policy 4.7, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the details shown on the submitted drawings, further details of the end elevations of the second floor balconies shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority within 3 months of the commencement of the development and the development shall be completed in accordance with this approved detail.   Reason : In order to safeguard the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties  in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004), policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012) and policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document with Minor Changes (February 2013)
